canvas_sdk.client.base module¶

canvas_sdk.client.base.call(action, url, request_context, params=None, data=None, max_retries=None, auth_token=None, files=None, headers=None, cookies=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, verify=None, cert=None, allow_redirects=True)[source]¶

This method servers as a pass-through to the requests library request functionality, but provides some configurable default values. Constructs and sends a requests.Request. Returns requests.Response object.

Parameters:
  • action – method for the new Request object.
  • url – Absolute url path to API method
  • request_context – Instance of RequestContext that holds a request session and other default values
  • params – (optional) Dictionary or bytes to be sent in the query string for the Request.
  • data – (optional) Dictionary, bytes, or file-like object to send in the body of the Request.
  • max_retries (int) – (optional) Number of times a request that generates a certain class of HTTP exception will be retried before being raised back to the caller. See client.base for a list of those error types.
  • files – (optional) Dictionary of ‘name’: file-like-objects (or {‘name’: (‘filename’, fileobj)}) for multipart encoding upload.
  • headers (dictionary) – (optional) dictionary of headers to send for each request. Will be merged with a default set of headers.
  • cookies (dictionary or CookieJar) – (optional) Cookies to attach to each requests.
  • auth_token (str) – (optional) OAuth2 token retrieved from a Canvas site
  • timeout (float) – (optional) The timeout of the request in seconds.
  • proxies (dictionary) – (optional) Mapping protocol to the URL of the proxy.
  • verify (boolean or str) – (optional) if True, the SSL cert will be verified. A CA_BUNDLE path can also be provided.
  • cert (str or Tuple) – (optional) if String, path to ssl client cert file (.pem). If Tuple, (‘cert’, ‘key’) pair.
  • allow_redirects (bool) – (optional) Set to True if POST/PUT/DELETE redirect following is allowed. Defaults to True.
canvas_sdk.client.base.delete(request_context, url, payload=None, **optional_request_params)[source]¶

Shortcut for making a DELETE call to the API

canvas_sdk.client.base.get(request_context, url, payload=None, **optional_request_params)[source]¶

Shortcut for making a GET call to the API. Data is passed as url params.

canvas_sdk.client.base.merge_or_create_key_value_for_dictionary(target, key, value=None)[source]¶

This helper method will attempt to update a given key on a target dictionary with a value. If the value is empty, nothing is done. If the key does not currently exist on the target, the key-value pair is created; otherwise, the given value is merged into the current key’s value in the target (it’s assumed an existing key is a dictionary).

Parameters:
  • target (dictionary) – The dictionary to merge into
  • key (str) – The key to merge or create on the target
  • value (Dictionary or None) – The value to merge into the dictionary key
canvas_sdk.client.base.post(request_context, url, payload=None, **optional_request_params)[source]¶

Shortcut for making a POST call to the API

canvas_sdk.client.base.put(request_context, url, payload=None, **optional_request_params)[source]¶

Shortcut for making a PUT call to the API
